reviews.review_msg: Rodney is such a nice professor. The lectures were a bit heavy (just because the course load itself is heavy) but he is really caring and you should not feel any barrier to ask questions

Chicken scratch notes, no clear lecture structure, no clear quiz or test information…Do I keep going? Possibly one of the WORST engineering profs I've ever come across. Also, he overloads you with assignments every single week with 0 consideration of other courses. Rodney is the type of professor to think his course is the only one you're taking.

This professor discourages honest students. The plagiarism/AI quiz says to cite AI, but never mention it in assignments—it will backfire. If quizzes are weak but assignments strong, he thinks you rely too much on AI. Exams don't allow cheat sheets; his formula sheet is mostly useless. Exams are very long, and most students can't finish.
Rodney is awesome and hilarious. He has a lot of practical knowledge, which he shares in his lectures and assignments.

The quizzes are worth 25% of your final mark with each quiz being around 2.5%. He does not mention what the quizzes will be on at all and thinks they're easy to everyone. 2nd exam is cooked. All the questions are based off a previous one so if you skip a question then it's over. Question 4 also goes all the way to q. No information about any test.

I think Rodney's assignments and exams were pretty straight forward. Once you read the questions properly, all the questions were solvable. His office hours were great; he explained the unclear or difficult questions in detail. Downfall is his lecture notes are a bit disorganized and lectures sometimes go slightly off topic and not following notes.

He definitely isn't the best at lecturing but i think he gets the general ideas across. His grading scheme puts heavy emphasis on assignments so if you put alot of effort into those its hard to fail, however they do take quite a bit of time. Exams were ok if you studied but occasionally there were crazy strange questions that nobody got correct

Rodney is very patient and kind, he is a very caring prof, but his lectures are him trying to follow his unorganized notes & examples that have wrong answers. Skipping class helped my marks go up b/c teaching myself was a better use of class time. I came out of this knowing less about circuits, this course needs to be revamped badly.

Rodney is a controversial professor due to his lecture's being of little use and having tests on the difficult side especially midterm 2. However, he is very caring and understanding of students, very helpful in office hours. He weighs homework equal to tests, usually a 50/50 split, and along with a scale to a B class, allows students to do well.

Rodney's a good guy, but a terrible professor. He's difficult to follow when lecturing and spends the majority of time rambling, leaving the actual learning for your own time. He cares about his students. He also gives tons of homework, but they help with understanding. My advice: take ENSC 380 & 383 first. This class is a breeze after those.

Worst ENSC Professor at SFU. His lectures are messy, disorganized and don't prepare you for the content that he puts on the exams. His exam averages are appalling which reflects his teaching. Avoid at ALL COSTS.

I'd like to extend my heartfelt applause and deepest gratitude to Professor Rodney Vaughan. His exceptional guidance and unwavering support were instrumental in the successful completion of my PhD. Professor Vaughan's profound knowledge and dedication to his students make him an outstanding educator and mentor. Thank you, Professor Vaughan.
He is the Best. He helped me understand the basics that matter the most.

Rodney is one of the worst professors I have ever had. His lectures are incredibly disorganized, yet they are the only source of information, as his note packages seem to be made by a 12 year old. His handwriting is very hard to decipher as well. Rodney is one of those profs that takes the beauty out of engineering.

Your life will be much easier if you have taken 380 and maybe 383 before this class. I really dislike his lecture notes. They are very confusing to follow. However, he is not monotone and delivers engaging lectures. Put all your effort into perfecting your assignments, as they have the most weight.
Great approachable guy but tough class

This man managed to put exactly what I did not study on the exam two times in a row!

3/5 if it happens again for the final.

Sfu decided to assign the worst professor in the world to one of the most important engineering classes. Easily worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are all over the place nonsensical, half of the info is useless. His notes look absolutely terrible and he doesn't follow the textbooks he said he would. Avoid at any cost

Old-school but in a very bad way. Lectures are incomprehensible both due to rapid speed and illegible handwriting. Homework and notes are both custom made by him and equally scattershot and disconnected. Very unfortunate for engineers to take such an important class with such an incompetent teacher. Learning anything with him is very difficult.
Was well equipped for zoom lectures. This was a challenging course, pay attention.

The only reason I selected "Yeah" for textbook use, is because that is all you will use, his lectures don't teach you a thing. Plus the textbook is shorter than his lecture notes... a lot less pages in the text book.
No. Just no.
I can't even comprehend why SFU allows this guy to teach. His exams are so long and convoluted, and his assignments are an enormous amount of work. Worst prof I have ever had.

tl;dr : You will have to teach yourself everything as Rodney is useless. If I could rate him a zero, I would. He should not be allowed to teach. I have never experienced something so disorganized. This entire class is a complete disaster. 20+ page assignments, ambiguous grading policies, impossibly long exams, and the worst lecture delivery ever.

This guy shouldn't be allowed to teach undergrad classes. The lack of organization and structure alone is unreal. Finished this class with the realization that I have learned absolutely nothing. Waste of money and time.
Assignments cover the scope of the entire course. DO well on those.

Lecture notes are dozens of slides with a ton of information - way too much to process in a single lecture. Homework is often long and tedious. Exams both take from the homework (copy-paste) and tangentially related material. The lab course was essentially a free 15%. Rodney tends to teach like it's a graduate-level course, which is unacceptable.
If this man ever tells you that the final will be easier and shorter than the midterm, DON'T BELIEVE A WORD OF IT

A nice man who is very smart, but can't teach/lecture to save his life. Lecture slides are hundreds of pages and literal walls of text. He reuses the previous year's assignments so if you don't have a plug, good luck. Probably the most disorganized prof I've ever had.

Very passionate but very unorganized about the class. Jumps from topic to topic randomly. He assumes a lot of non-pre-requisite material is known but goes over simple arithmetic that should already be known.
You know sometimes if you get hit you get hit, and we definitely got hit by that final.
Terrible teaching skill and all student get lost during the lecture. He helps nothing to this course. Almost everything need learn by yourself.
Assignments and lab were easy worth 40% of total grade. Exams were mixed easy or long. So overall not baf. Math questions were interesting. He's nice & lead TA, was very helpful. Thanks
To be honest, his grading is horrible! Gives out very low grade! Dont take his class! And his TA is even worse. Dont want to talk about the details.

Worthless professor because you don't learn what you are supposed to in class. Notes are worthless because he is all over the place when going through them. Exams are worthless because they are often off topic. You might as well throw 500$ out the window, but that at least can still do good to the world. I am deeply sadden by this professor.

Highly unorganized. Had a year to prep the course and while he wrote a lot, he prioritized his time terribly and focused on the wrong things. Grades were VERY late, including exams, homework, and final grade. Exams were very long and often only tangentially related to material. Still don't know my final grade weeks after the semester ended.
He's  a good Professor  & very knowledgeable.
Rodney: "This will be a short and easy final. It shouldn't take too long so take your time".  A worse liar than the NSA.
Clear concept explanation in class. Simple Assignment and exam. GPA Booster
Easy Assignment. Easy Class. I got an A+ on the final. Highly recommended. His lecture course is interesting. I bet you would enjoy it

Notes aren't the best, lectures arent the most straightforward or easily absorbed but very interesting and useful. Often teaches very practical knowledge so thats nice.  Attend lectures and put in work and you'll find yourself with a lot of accomplishment by the end of term.
ONE OF THE BEST PROF I HAD IN SFU, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Prof Vaughan was one of the few profs who I could see eye to eye with that I knew truly wanted me along with  the class to succeed. Although mediocre with organisation he was there very often for help and enjoyed questions being asked during and after class time. Just don't expect him to know everything but he'll help if he can.

I feel that I may have taken this course for granted. Since marking is fairly generous, it really lets you explore what this course is about. I learned a lot of things in this course because we are allow to make mistakes and not get penalised too hard for it. Still have to work your butt off to understand the concept though. And very good TAs

I actually put a bad rating here before but now  I think he's trying to help students. He's a nice Prof  with a very different style and yes lecture notes are confusing & long so you need to go to the class and fill the notes, he's not exactly following a textbook.
he is nice prof, but confuse lecture.  But I can see he has been trying hard. And his notes is  detailed.  I can not really blame him. Have to work harder in this class. tks
Through the notes*

If you don't go to any classes (like me), you should still be able to walk yourself through them because they are actually pretty clear and detailed. The guy gets too much hate IMO although he does do some things last minute and rushes assignments.. He may not be the best lecturer but he does try and he's been very generous with the marking so far.
Can I rate him less than 0?
I THINK HE IS GOOD PROFESSOR

Notes are not complete and are usually filled in during class, but there are problems with HIS lectures that prevents this. 1) When filling out the examples, he goes to another screen and scribbles stuff all over the place . 2) I usually print my notes, and even if I do copy down what he writes, his typos makes my printed set obsolete.

Lots of typos and maybes in assignment solutions. Takes forever to mark the assignments. Constantly changing the requirements in the lab instructions. Dr. Vaughan, if you prefer to do your scientific research with PHD students, don't teach  us undergrads. If you do teach undergrads, put time and effort into it.

I'm paying tuition but there's no help  and my GPA is getting ruined because of him.  He doesn't even give  information to  TAs. He announced we have midterm in 2 weeks but do we know what is really covered or any formula sheet? No and it's 2 days before exam. Easy course & interesting but his notes is confusing even  for himself  in the class.

Very unorganized lectures and lecture notes are also unwelcome by students in this class. Any such lectures shall be promptly reflected on RateMyProfessors as students encounter them. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST!!!!! ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT TOMORROW STAR!!!

I don't know what to study, what to get ready for, all random things pop up his mind. Solution to assignment was full of maybe and assuming this & that. Students weren't sure what is covered in midterm. God save us, all class gonna fail.
Don't take it, you won't learn anything  and if not pass you get a D or C. Text Book is good but he's not following anything even the subject. Confusing on what is we learning in this class.

Doesn't follow any book even his notes. I don't know if I'm taking 380,383 or 320,327 or math. I  don't know what to study, what to get ready for,  all random things pop up his mind. Solution to assignment was full of maybe and assuming this & that. Students  weren't sure what is covered in midterm. God save us, all class gonna fail.
YEEHOO!! Post the assignment solution in the last minute before midterm. Text book and notes are crap

Doesn't give full notes with examples after class. In class, he skips half his notes (which have many errors) and does examples without clear goals (what are we solving for again?). Didn't post solutions to the one assignment before the midterm. He spends at least 10 mins per class figuring out how his tablet works. AVOID IF YOU VALUE YOUR GPA!!
avoid
hard class, confuse lecture, with too little help
Don't take 320 with him if you can avoid it. he posts notes, which is nice, but notes are hard to understand.
He's not very good at communicating the material. A month in and I still don't know what I am suppose to be learning in this course....
It is hilarious his lecture, too late too drop
